info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 29 at 9:20AM CDT until June 2 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile AL
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama...
Tombigbee River Near Coffeeville Dam affecting Clarke, Washington and Choctaw Counties.
Tombigbee River Near Leroy affecting Clarke and Washington Counties.
For the Tombigbee River...including Coffeeville Dam, Coffeeville Dam - Pool, Leroy...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Tombigbee River near Leroy.
* WHEN...From this evening to Monday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Flooding of low lying farm and pasturelands begins. Cattle in low lying areas should be moved to higher ground. Water approaches low lying roads on west side of river.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 23.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 25.2 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.2 feet on 03/31/2024. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/mob. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations.
The next statement will be issued when updates occur.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO MONDAY AFTERNOON
